sentence.Network_en: All I wanted was to find out why you don't want to be promoted to forewoman.
sentence.Network_cn: 我就要问你,为什么你不愿意升管车?

sentence.Network_en: I've mentioned your name to the proprietor, and we're thinking of making you a forewoman.
sentence.Network_cn: 我同老板说过了, 打算升你做管车.

means.word_mean: 1. a woman who is foreperson of a jury
2. a woman in charge of a group of workers

auth_sentence.content: "I've never known anyone with the ability to become so many people," said jury forewoman Kristen Lee, an attorney.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I've never known anyone with the ability to become so many people," said jury forewoman Kristen Lee, an attorney.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I've never known anyone with the ability to become so many people," said jury forewoman Kristen Lee, an attorney.

auth_sentence.content: Until Agnes Jongerius, forewoman of the Dutch workers union, marched into my living room last week.
